paper_abstract: The use of women workers in early computing and advertising ironically may have hurt their long-term professional position in the field because it reflected, and helped shape, their role as low-cost, unskilled workers. This article traces the relationship between advertising images of women used to sell data processing equipment and the early, feminized, data processing labor force in Great Britain.
paper_title: Only the Clothes Changed: Women Operators in British Computing and Advertising, 1950-1970
